name: Jose Zapatos
text: Even if the death penalty did prevent crime, what do you do with mistaken convictions?

source_obj.text: Even if the death penalty did prevent crime, what do you do with mistaken convictions?

replies.text: My Philo of Law prof told me that prevention is most correlated with likelihood of arrest-convicti on-punishment. (Not necessarily fear of death) ... Because, if you won't even get caught... what's the point?
Any system can be gamed for the best probable outcomes. So one important question is:  ▪ Your system is consistently what? ▪
